content: I learned from the backgroud information section that corporate personhood allowed corporations to be treated as separate legal entities from their owners. I did not know much or anaything about this before reading the section. Coporations I learned can do all the legal stuff (which I already knew about) but I didn't know it was formally defined like this. I have heard about critics say corporate personhood is doing too much expanding (capitalism) though didn't know it was also mentioned specifically in the case of corporate personhood.
